column5: My rendering of Gord's song.....  I know that tomorrow is remembrance day but we should also remember this.  <object width="357" height="458"><param name="movie" value="http://www.singsnap.com/karaoke/e/b6d1ce83"></param><param'>http://www.singsnap.com/karaoke/e/b6d1ce83"></param><param name="wmode" value="transparent"></param><embed src="http://www.singsnap.com/karaoke/e/b6d1ce83" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" width="357" height="458"></embed></object>  thanks for listening.  Randy
When I was a kid in University we use to have a few pints and sit down in the park across from the Maritime Sailors Cathedral and sing rousing renditions of this song.
http://www.boatnerd.com/fitz/  A bit more info on this subject.
A great song from a great Canadian singer/songwriter!  To everyone else that takes their wee little boat out on the Great Lakes...  Always have the proper amount of respect!

Isn't today the date of the CPR derailment in Mississauga in 1979??  I was visiting from Montreal and heard the BOOM and saw the flames of the train - we were visiting in Rexdale.  Jeez, time goes by a way too fast!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  David  aka  Superdad

I don't remember the exact date, but it was November. We stayed in Rexdale at my sister's boyfriend's parent's house for a week. We lived only a few blocks away from the derailment on the Credit Woodlands.
thanks gang!!!    I, apparently had a cousin on that boat.

Yes it is, my sister was living very near there at the time. One of my classmates in college was the second police officer on scene that night. http://www.mississauga.ca/portal/residents/derailmentgallery
